Reviews.Title: Not perfect, but not bad.  You get what you pay for.
Reviews.Author: Nathan Gaude
Reviews.Content: I bought this for an upcoming trip to take snorkeling, but first wanted to test it out.  So I went to a pool party for a 4 year old, and gave the camera to my 6 year old neice and told her to do whatever she wanted with it. I posted 2 pics above for you to see.  I figured it a good score just for still working after a 6 year old dropped it into the pool twice, and once even got a nice big scratch on the side, but still works great. The pics aren't perfect, a little washed out, but the only reason I bought this camera was to take it underwater, and the price.  I'm sure if you spent more money for the canon it might take better pics, but these will do just fine for me.  So if you are looking for a basic underwater camera that takes decent pics, more for photo albums than publishing, this camera is probably for you.  The kids LOVED it, and if my 6 year old neice can work it underwater, everyone else should have no trouble.  The only Con I have is that the battery was almost completely drained after about an hour and a half underwater.  Don't know if it uses up more power somehow underwater, but that is my only concern.  Haven't tested it long enough to know if that is normal or not yet.

Reviews.Title: Tested at the store... Disappointed.
Reviews.Author: whoareyou
Reviews.Content: I very recently bought the new Fuji Z33 WP camera, but since I am unhappy with the high levels of image noise, I will be returning it and looking for a replacement.  The other top camera on my list was the Olympus 550WP.  I went to a major electronics store yesterday and had the opportunity to play with the 550WP.  The salesman even let me put my microSD card into the camera to save some test shots to view on my computer at home.The image quality does not make me excited to buy this camera.  The pictures show a significant amount of noise, even when I forced the ISO down to 100.  Every shot without a flash looks pale and slightly hazy.  With a flash, the image quality improved, but there is still an unreasonable amount of image noise.  The best shots were taken of objects about 10 feet away.  This was a good distance to prevent the flash from washing out the subject, but still providing an adequate amount of light to get a decent picture.  Even those shots seemed to lack sharpness.  They were OK, but I guess I expected more.  I understand that there are trade-offs in image quality when buying a waterproof camera, but I had hoped that they wouldn't be this bad.Besides image quality, my only other complaint was the couple of seconds delay between shots.  The screen goes blank, so you can't even compose your next shot while you wait.  The noticible delay upon startup and between shots was a deal-breaker for me when deciding if the image quality was acceptable.On a positive note, the size and shape of the camera is pleasing and it feels well-built and sturdy.  It is not too heavy, and I didn't feel like I needed to be overly protective of it.  It's not ultra-thin, but it could easily fit into a pocket.  Also, I really liked the menu graphics.  The menu structure seems very similar to that of the Olympus weatherproof cameras from the last couple of years, but the icons on the 550WP are in color and are much brighter.  This may seem trivial, but it definitely makes for a flashier interface than the couple of models just prior to the 550WP.  I also tried out the Tough Series 8000 and noticed that it shares the very cool, updated menu graphics with the 550WP.I wanted to like this camera and it was my top choice to replace the Fuji Z33, but I was not satisfied enough with the test shots I took to spend my money on it.  The slightly older and mixed-reviewed Olympus 850SW that I tested on the same visit responded much more quickly on startup, on auto-focusing, and in recovering between shots.  It felt fast in all areas and the pictures were much better than the Oly 550WP and the Fuji Z33 WP.  The image quality on the 850SW wasn't perfect either, but I was much more excited about its performance than the two newer cameras.  Since it has been out for a little longer than the 550WP and Z33, the 850SW can be found for a similar price.  Without spending the extra $100 to step up to the next level of image quality and performance, I think my money is going to the Oly 850SW instead of the Oly 550WP or the Fuji Z33.

Reviews.Title: Slow
Reviews.Author: Kerwinm12345
Reviews.Content: I do love this camera for a variety of reasons, but the one thing that really irks me about it is the time between when you press the button and when it takes the picture- it's annoyingly long...

Reviews.Title: ScenicHikingPhotos .com
Reviews.Author: C. E. Mattingly "Charlie"
Reviews.Content: I was headed to the Grand Canyon for a rafting & photo trip.  I needed a camera that was waterproof, and found at amazon.com the Olympus 550wp.  It was priced right so I ordered it.  It performed like a champion.  On the raft we was soaked with in the first minute, as though we were scuba diving.  The camera worked all through out the trip.  You can see images of the pictures I took on my web site:  [...]

Reviews.Title: Flawed Genius
Reviews.Author: Rev. Thomas Scarborough
Reviews.Content: The first Olympus digital camera I owned was the Camedia C-2 Zoom, launched in 2002. This was an extremely popular camera, not least because of its superb cost performance.  Sales far exceeded expectations, causing Olympus' purchasing departments some trouble in keeping pace with demand for materials and parts.  In my experience, the camera's popularity was well deserved.  It was on the strength of this experience that I decided, in 2009, to buy the very latest Olympus ì-550WP.  On the surface of it, this was a tough little package that combined the best features of earlier Olympus cameras at a modest (for Olympus) price.Regrettably, from the moment I had it out of the box, this camera presented me with a long string of snags that, had I anticipated them, would have caused me to think twice.Beginning with the battery/recharger (which in many cameras is conveniently combined into one), the mains plug worked only in some power sockets, not in others. The battery went flat faster than expected -- and to make matters worse, the charge indicator went from full to flat in the blink of an eye. This meant that my camera required two hours' recharging, and was unexpectedly out of action at the very moment I intended to put it to its first serious use. Part of the problem, perhaps, was that I had not realised, when accessing the flash card inside the camera through the camera cable, that there was a drain on the battery.  Yet nowhere was I warned about this.  Many digital cameras do not discharge when plugged in.  I decided to use the "power save" feature to give me better prospects next time round -- yet this kept blanking out the display while I was framing a picture.  And every time, the camera wiped out the settings I was working with. So I went to buy a back-up battery -- which cost me more than a tenth of the (not too cheap) camera.I registered the Olympus software over the Internet, as requested, and Olympus confirmed the registration. Very soon, however, an ineradicable message came up on my screen, insisting on further registration for some plug-ins.  This process hogged my Internet connection, which from my location in Africa was not a luxury easily to be afforded.  As my broadband usage shot up profligately, I cut off the connection.  On returning to the Olympus software, however, Olympus once more requested registration -- and the plug-ins I could not find.  It was the Panorama feature that interested me the most.  I clicked on the Panorama icon -- yet an unrelated Olympus pop-up appeared, obscuring the screen. When I tested the Panorama feature, it did not stitch well at all.  The manual didn't say as much, but apparently this feature should only be used at certain distances. Yet even the correct distances didn't necessarily yield good results.  Apparently a panoramic view should be taken in bright light in order to stitch without banding -- again no mention was made of this was made in the manual.  One would think that the software could have addressed such problems.These were only the beginning of my problems with the Olympus ì-550WP -- but let me pause first to highlight some of its strengths and attractions.  The Olympus ì-550WP is undoubtedly very pocketable.  It is a pleasure to carry around.  And it is attractive -- one might say "cute".  It is also waterproof to three metres or ten feet (but more of this in a moment). It does take some nice panoramic pictures, if distance and lighting are appropriate. The zoom works well, if jerkily.  Also, it offers a macro feature and a super-macro feature (as close as 7 centimeters or 2.8 inches), which have performed well.  The movie mode has also performed well.  The camera has recorded smoothly and without any "skipping", as some digital cameras do.  I also like its easy white-balance, ISO, and resolution settings. The camera also has an "intelligent" setting which generally works well -- but I have sometimes found it to be hit and miss (as the manual says it may be in some situations), so that I would rather rely on my own judgement.But back to my troubles.  These have been various, and I shall survey them (not all of them) quickly.  Photography in bright light is good, but in subdued light without flash (often required in my profession) the Olympus clearly under-performs.  Photos in subdued light are markedly more grainy than those taken with other digital cameras using similar settings.  With this in mind, the 10 megapixel resolution of the camera seems academic.  Cameras with half the resolution may outperform the Olympus ì-550WP.  Bright lights (not least the sun) prove to be a problem, too.  The camera repeatedly produces "shadow" images of overhead lights in strange places, or blue smudges from the sun, where this is well out of the "field of vision".  The layout of the face of the camera presents problems.  Consider, for instance, how a person would hold this camera without obscuring the flash, or closing the microphone.  Even if the owner should learn the trick, this is by no means guaranteed for anyone else who might use it -- for instance, someone taking a photo of the owner.  The anti-red-eye flash feature does not necessarily avoid red-eye. Finally, although it works, I am not much impressed with the underwater feature.  After using the camera in water, it is difficult to clear the lens of water droplets, which tend to reappear every time one closes and opens the external "steel door" shutter.I would have liked to speak well of my new Olympus camera, after my early experiences with the Olympus Camedia C-2 Zoom.  All in all, perhaps the greatest strength of the Olympus ì-550WP would be as an "outdoors" camera used, for example, for beach sports, scuba diving, or sunny surrounds (but bear in mind those "shadow"  images).  It would also perform well in many situations where a flash is judiciously used.  But it begins to reveal its weaknesses particularly in more subdued light without flash (dusky evenings or indoor shots), or for sporadic use in the wet.

Reviews.Title: Very Happy
Reviews.Author: Kitchen Cleaners "Kitchen Cleaners"
Reviews.Content: We use this camera in wet, industrial environments.  Previously, I'd buy cheap products that would last a couple of months.  This camera stands up to the abuse our guys give it.  We're very pleased.

Reviews.Title: Good when it works, but unreliable
Reviews.Author: Catalina Sailor
Reviews.Content: I purchased this underwater Olympus because I already had the unique batteries and memory cards for my weatherproof Olympus 760. I also liked the size and appearance. However, after a few uses on a trip, it "froze up" to the point where it could not be turned off. None of the buttons worked, and the only solution was to remove the battery while it was still turned on. This happened repeatedly so I returned the camera to the local camera store. They sent it back to Olympus, who replaced the circuit board. Great. Took it on another vacation, but this time, I took both this Olympus and my old Olympus. That was a good thing because the 550WP frequently overheated and froze up. I could temporarily resolve the problem by removing the battery, cooling it down, and reinserting the battery for a few more pictures. I decided to use it mostly for underwater (snorkeling) pictures. It worked well in the water, except, because it is slow on the shutter (much slower than the 3 years older Olympus.) That's a major flaw, because the fish were much faster than the shutter, and I got many pictures of just coral, sand, or grass. When it does take pictures on land, especially in landscape mode (which highlights the blues and greens), it works very well. Unfortunately, I cannot recommend this camera because of its unreliability. Next time, I think I'll get a point-and-shoot with a viewfinder (so I can see what I'm photographing in bright sunlight) and an underwater case.

Reviews.Title: You should see my Manatee pictures!!!
Reviews.Author: M. L. Antonsen
Reviews.Content: I used to take "professional" underwater photos and I love this little camera.  I went to Three Sister's Springs and when I showed my photos to friends they thought they were postcards.  They were shocked at the quality.  Just remember for underwater shots, turn OFF the flash as all the flash will light up is particles in the water.  I did have a drop of water on my battery when I went to pull out the card but as inexpensive as this camera is, I don't care if I have to replace it every 2-3 years.

Reviews.Title: I love this camera!
Reviews.Author: Mary Thompson
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a good, inexpensive, compact digital camera that takes good quality pictures and has cool features, this is the camera for you. Without setting the resolution quality to high, the pictures come out OK. I was not completely satisfied with the quality of the images until I found out that you can set the camera to take higher resolution photos and videos. Now I am very happy with the picture quality. I would suggest buying a 2gb or 4gb micro SD card, so you can fit lots of high quality pictures and videos. I have a 4gb card that I found for $20 and I can take over 600 pictures at the maximum resolution. Or over 30 minutes of video. The camera does have a microphone, so you can take videos with sound, even underwater. Having sound underwater is somewhat pointless, but it's fun to have that feature. Underwater, the pictures and videos look really good. I have had my camera for about 6 months now, and I have had no problems with it. One thing that is bad about it is the screen. The screen is not very good, and sometimes makes pictures look blurry and out of focus, when on the computer they look great. Also, this camera does not have a viewfinder. It isn't a big deal to me, but for others it might be. I would have liked for this camera to be able to take regular SD cards, but it does take micro SD cards, and mine came with an adapter. One last thing that I suggest you get is a floating strap. It is so that if you drop your camera in the water it will float, and be visible, because this camera does not float. Overall, I would suggest this camera because it is fun, inexpensive, durable, portable, and takes good pictures.

Reviews.Title: Very fun camera
Reviews.Author: David J. Denner
Reviews.Content: So I bought this camera after I already have a nikon d3000. I surf daily and decided to check this thing out. What your paying is a deal thy definatly worth it. I take a wave, thn on the way swimming back take shots of other people getting barreled! Pic quality is good enough. The only thing that I suggest is if you decide to get it, when using in water buy the glass cleaner rain-x to clean the front lens so not as much water spots slow you down. Overall I can't even tell you how many cool pics I have got with this thing!

Reviews.Title: Affordable Olympus Camera
Reviews.Author: T. J. Tekena
Reviews.Content: Its a very good camera for the price and functions like water-resistance and is also light in the hands. The picture quality isn't the best i'v used for 10 megapixel cameras but does a great job for every day shoots.

Reviews.Title: False Advertisement! - NOT at all WATERPROOF
Reviews.Author: Sade
Reviews.Content: I purchased an Olympus Stylus - 550 WP supposedly waterproof camera in the middle of July 2009.Unfortunately, the camera was anything but waterproof.  In March of 2010 when I went to the beach, I'm in our hotel pool, acting as the photog, because I know that my camera is the only waterproof camera.  I made note of the instructions' warning -- the camera is completely waterproof up to "10 feet deep" in water.  While I'm taking photos in 3 or 4 feet deep water (mind you, this is a hotel swimming pool, no more than 6 deep at the most), my  WATERPROOF camera malfunctions.  Camera was a $150 WASTE.From this point on, the camera never worked well again.  The device immediately prompted me to remove the camera's memory card and to "Clean card" or to "Format Card".  I cleaned the card with a cloth as the Olympus help text suggested.  Still, the camera could barely power on, focus and take more than one or two pics without prompting me with the same messages.In July 2010, I went back to the beach and the camera was completely not functional.  I emailed Olympus support and was told then to clean the SD card (duh...) and that my card could be ruined, but the camera was fine. I have used the same memory card and Olympus card reader and they have both worked fine in other cameras, camera phones, computers, printers, photo kiosks, etc. The possibility of a warranty swap was never mentioned and since I was told to "clean the card" as was instructed, I focused more on the SD cards than on getting a new camera through my warranty.  The support response was only smoke and mirrors to distract me from the real problem.  The camera was not as advertised, which is a bigger disappointment than the broken camera.  I would never jump in a pool with a non-waterproof camera, because I understand what the outcome would be.  On the contrary, I used this very camera at the beach and in the pool, because I was lead to believe that I could do so, as long as we were swimming above 10 feet.  Thats obviously the difference between skydiving with a fully-functional parachute vs. with a broken one.  Who would purposely do that?  I wouldn't have, unless I was told that I could, which technically, I was.

Reviews.Title: Nice, if you don't use it near water
Reviews.Author: Christopher Nelson "Littlekafka"
Reviews.Content: The first time I used my camera was in a pool. It worked well enough though the images were not nearly as good as my friends canon. nor was the user interface as easy. But it worked and it was a gift.Second time, same pool same experience. Except the battery barely lasted an hour.The third time was in the ocean and it did not work at all. Water had somehow made its way into every part of the camera, before i even made it to the water. behind the lens was soaked, Everywhere rendering it useless.Best of all the Tech Support at Olympus was very helpful. They answered relatively quickly to ask "do you have a receipt?" I answered "No. It was a gift, but I sent in the registration"WIthout a receipt they could not do anything. Would not do anything. So If you get this, even as a gift, make sure the giftee gets a receipt.

Reviews.Title: Not waterproof
Reviews.Author: wanderlust18 "wanderlust18"
Reviews.Content: will post pictures later. We have had only for six months. I have made sure all ports are secure. We got water in the camera. Not sure how water got in the camera since it is suppose to be waterproof. And the warrenty does not cover water damage? This was our first Olympus camera going to stick with canon and nikon.

Reviews.Title: Great Little Camera
Reviews.Author: David W. Study "David Study Crossing Guard"
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera so I could use it in the rain, no problems at all in this respect. I haven't used it under water. The on - off button is a little hard  to use with a glove on.  I use it on a corner to take picts of moving cars. Great results. Weak point is a very short battery life. But the plus side of that is the the quick recharge cycle. Another nice feature I found, is the large number of thumbnails it can display when you are searching for a picture already taken. Oh yes, I dropped it early on from about four feet to the sidewalk a nick in finish but stills functions very well.

Reviews.Title: Disappointed
Reviews.Author: traveltoscrapit
Reviews.Content: Olympus Stylus 550WP 10MP Waterproof Digital Camera with 3x Optical Zoom and 2.5-inch LCD (Black)I used to own the Olympus 720wp and it was one of the best underwater/versitile compact cameras I owned.  When our house burned down 2 yrs ago I immediately replaced it and my choices were the 550wp or the stylus tough.  I bought the Stylus Tough and was diappointed and returned it within 2 weeks, I ended up with the 550wp and this things just plain sucks!!  I have had to delete so many blury pictures, so many memories erased because of this.  Recently I was in Flordia snorkeling on day 2 and the camera just quit working.  I got back on land once back into the room I opened the battery area to charge the battery thinking that was what was wrong and water poured out of it.  at least the memory card did save the whole 10 pics that I took on day 1 of our trip.  Needless to say I could not take any pics the rest of my vaca with it and now Olympus said that it seems as though it is user error and will not cover anything.  Well I have a solution I ain't gonna buy another one of your crappy products and I am gonna blog and write horrible reviews anywhere I can!Looking at the new Cannon waterproof to buy for Myrtle Beach in 3 weeks.

Reviews.Title: Olympus 550WP is a piece of junk!
Reviews.Author: Dave
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera thinking I was getting a good underwater camera. The first time I used it I just took a few regular pictures at my house, nothing underwater. Then when I tried to get the pictures to download to my computer the camera froze up. It kept saying "unplug the USB cable' I unplugged the cable but nothing happened. I have tried everything to get my camera to work. I took out the battery, and the memory card waited ten minutes reinserted them and the camera still freezes up. I have gone on line and found that there are MANY people experiencing the same problem for which there apparently is NO FIX. So if you want to throw away your money go ahead and buy this camera, but it is totally useless.

Reviews.Title: Waterproof Not this one
Reviews.Author: wltgl
Reviews.Content: First time we took this camera in the water it quite working. Have a pentax optio wp for five years that has been in the ocean several times works like a charm wasted money on the olympus buy PENTAX OPTIO if you want it to do what it supposed to.

Reviews.Title: It's not underwater at all!!!
Reviews.Author: Miguel
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for a trip to Punta Cana, Dominican Republic and I took some Ok photos but then I took 2 photos underwater in a pool (2 feet)and the camera stopped working, I opened the battery door and it was all full of water... I'll never buy Olympus again!!!

Reviews.Title: HORRIBLE OUTDOOR PICTURES!
Reviews.Author: Lauren Lamastra "Camera Nerd"
Reviews.Content: i recently just bought this camera, i was so excited to use it, and to try it under water. The underwater pictures came out great, but the outdoor pictures came out horrible! The image was dark, and not very clear. I reccomend getting the stylus 850 sw, its alot better, but more expensive, but its definitly worth it.

Reviews.Title: Scrap
Reviews.Author: Iain Jc Kirkpatrick
Reviews.Content: This is the worst camera you could possibly spend your money on, i feel as if Ive been robbed! Its rubbish, the delay after taking a photo has to be seen to believed its not waterproof either. Ive wasted my money on it, its for the bin!!

Reviews.Title: Do not buy this camera
Reviews.Author: W. Dean "VW Lover"
Reviews.Content: My son and I both bought Olympus so called waterproof cameras and both leaked within the first year. Mine started working again once it dried out so I cleaned the seals and went on holiday to Cuba. During the trip it leaked again and now it is dead. Google these cameras and you will see everyone is having problems with leaking. Junk, do not waste your money.

Reviews.Title: Good value, issue but Olympus took care of issue
Reviews.Author: JB4kids
Reviews.Content: I purchaced this camera less than a year ago, took it on vacation and got several good snorkling pictures. Picture quality was good, worked well. I ran out of battery life on the snorkling trips but took several hunderd pictures so more battery would have been nice but it was reasonable. I went on another vacation and went snorkling again, got several shots then the camera stopped working. Would not power on, may have been a leaking issue. I sent back to Olympus being less than a year old and they replaced it. I am satisfied.I read reveiws saying that that the picture quality was really bad, If you follow the directions it does well. It is not a SLR but does a good job for what it is. I enjoyed getting the pictures underwater.

Reviews.Title: Manually choose Setting = Good Photos
Reviews.Author: JK
Reviews.Content: I read a lot of reviews that said the picture quality was very grainy and white washed.  I bought one anyway and my first pictures were very bad.  I tried changing the setting and found this camera takes really good pictures.  I use mine mostly outside and use the appropriate setting and really like the photos.  Interior pictures are pretty good as well.  If you leave the camera on iPhoto setting you get below average pictures.  I have had my camera for roughly one year.  I take it to the lake, camping kayaking and for general use.  I would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: fuzzy pictures...
Reviews.Author: Ariela K. Gugenheim "Ariela K G"
Reviews.Content: It is light and pretty, but no matter what we tried, the pictures are sometimes good, but many times blurred, out of focus...

Reviews.Title: awesome
Reviews.Author: Jeffrey Schirmer
Reviews.Content: This camera is great, I wanted a camera for the boat and the beach where I dont have to worry about getting it wet or dropping it, and it does exactly what I wanted. I read about bad delay when taking a picture, but I havent noticed it

Reviews.Title: Olympus 10mp underwater camera
Reviews.Author: mom of 5 girls
Reviews.Content: The picture quality is not good at all. My 13 year old doesn't even use it because of this. I purchased the previous Olympus 8mp model (orange) for another daughter, and it takes much better pictures. I prefer the pictures from my older model Pentax underwater camera.

Reviews.Title: SO SO
Reviews.Author: Alexander Gherardi
Reviews.Content: The picture quality is not that good..I was hoping for a 10MP camera, they would be more clear.When you shoot in sport mode, it seems to give the best picture.Either way it does the job...

Reviews.Title: waterproof camera
Reviews.Author: ROBERT O HOLMES
Reviews.Content: love this camera.  spend a lot of time in the pool when on vacation.  so nice not to have to worry about ruining a camera while in the water.  got so many cool pics from the water level.

Reviews.Title: Crap Crap stay away
Reviews.Author: Nello Tropiano
Reviews.Content: Worked for one day , after one day of usage camera died , tried every single reset possible with no luck... I will never buy an olympus product again, support was crappy as well. Don't count on this camera for underwater fun...

Reviews.Title: recreational camera, good pictures in adverse conditions
Reviews.Author: tom quartz
Reviews.Content: i also carried this camera in costa rica, and i have to say, i dont have any of the problems the low rating reviewers have except for, after 6 months use, battery only holding charge for less than an hour. so im on here shopping for a new battery. wondering if the newer batteries are compatable. i am not a photographer, obviously as this is a recreational camera, but it took pretty darn good pics and awesome underwater videos of me and my friend naked in the crystal clear tidal pools off of pacific coast! for documenting life for gaia university it did a stellar job of good pictures in adverse conditions!

Reviews.Title: bad camera
Reviews.Author: Jamie
Reviews.Content: Frankly, this is just a bad camera. The images on "land" are very poor quality and never very good, the controls and settings are hard to use, and the camera is completely unpredictable. To top off the poor photo quality and all, I can't even use a normal USB cable to upload pictures. Now I have to go buy another cable because I lost mine and have no way to get the pictures on my laptop, unless I find a card reader that takes this type of card.I'd give it 1 star, but it gets 2 because it does take better pictures in the water than it does out. They still aren't that good though, and the flash delay is RIDICULOUS even in lighted areas.I've gotten a few fun pictures here and there but overall this camera is a frustration and disappointment. This is the only olympus I've experienced, but I think I'll stick with Canon. Even my cheap little canon point and shoot takes pictures 25x better than this one.

Reviews.Title: Piece of junk
Reviews.Author: Thomas B. Gibbs "tgibbs2000"
Reviews.Content: I ordered two of these for ourselves and some friends before we went to Mexico on a snorkeling and diving trip.  Both were pieces of junk.  The door to get into the battery/memory card area are impossible to open.  We had to use a screwdriver to get it open and do that to many times and it will likely never close or never open again.  They both leaked.  One didn't hold a charge.  When they did work, they took decent pictures.  But they both failed as underwater cameras.  A complete shame, my wife has a more expensive Olympus underwater camera.  Unfortunately, it didn't fair well on this trip either, but we did get 3 years out of if before it failed.  It leaked as well and my wife found a program that allowed to her retrieve the photos from the memory card despite the damage.  I guess we will get our next underwater camera from a manufacturer like Sealife.

Reviews.Title: Not a good Camera!
Reviews.Author: Nmcherryhill
Reviews.Content: I got this Camera for Christmas of 2009. I am 16 now, and I only use this camera if it is a must! The picture quality is horrible! If your getting it for use under water, then the quality is not to bad. It works under water, but the latch that keeps water from getting to the battery broke in the first 2 months. I can't use it in the water anymore. The camera's zoom is very bad, and makes almost all of the pictures I have taken blurry. I love taking pictures and I know how to use Cameras.I would not buy this camera!

Reviews.Title: Horrible Customer Service!!!!!!
Reviews.Author: Emily Winfield
Reviews.Content: I ordered this camera as a gift for my little sister before her vacation.  I got the camera fast! -- We opened the box to get things rolling and test out the camera.  Come to find out the battery door on the camera would not open.  I called the company twice, and left messages both times.  I also emailed the company and got no reply.  I was simply asking for instructions to return or even exchange the camera.  No response.  I returned it through amazons service, and still have not heard anything.  I will never order from this company again.

Reviews.Title: Very upset
Reviews.Author: Nichole
Reviews.Content: I was not happy at all when I recieved my camera. It was suppose to be brand new and there are scratches on it and the box is worn-apparently not new. Also it was suppose to come with a charger and it didnt so now I am stuck having to find the right charger and pay more than I should have to. I dont think I will be ordering online again

Reviews.Title: Waterproof and filled with water!!
Reviews.Author: MeghanJ "MJ"
Reviews.Content: This so called waterproof camera lasted a little over a year, which conveniently is right after its warranty period... and with a few splashes of water became filled with water. I called the repair center and for $75 they will repair it.. This camera was NOT cheap and I think it should have lasted more than it did and I dont find the qquality of its pictures to be worth spending another chunk of $ on it.. I will never buy another Olympus again!

Reviews.Title: Not Waterproof
Reviews.Author: Pcjoseph
Reviews.Content: The Camera is NOT WATERPROOF! I bought this camera from Best Buy in 2009 and took it to Belize in 2010. Worked great till I took it into a pool. For a dry camera, great quality and functions. Why its advertised as a waterproof, I have no idea. It lasted 2 photos underwater in a pool. After 3 days it dryed out and works fine, but i bought it as a underwater device. I could have spent 40 bucks and gotten a regular camera if thats what I wanted. Waste of money!!!

Reviews.Title: great cam
Reviews.Author: Esteban Esquivel Sanchez
Reviews.Content: really nice camera highly recomended!!! only problem is that my brother broke it but I just bought another one :D

Reviews.Title: Typical Olympus Quality -- Awful
Reviews.Author: Michael H. Malin Jr. "Thievery Corporation Fan"
Reviews.Content: Bough this camera on my beach vacation and all the buttons on the back stopped working the first time it was in the water.  I took it back and exchanged it the same day.  The first time the SECOND camera was in the water the same thing happened.  Got my money back.  I am not surprised Amazon no longer sells this, it is truly a hunk of junk.  The only reason it got one star is because Amazon does not let you give some thing zero stars.

Reviews.Title: Survived very rough conditions in Costa Rica...
Reviews.Author: Kale is Amazing
Reviews.Content: I took this camera on a field biology expedition to Costa Rica. I admit I didn't really use it for underwater photography, because visibility is crummy in the Pacific side of CR. However, I was looking for something that would be ok through rain, sweat, mud, and other harsh conditions.This camera did not disappoint on that front. It got dropped in the ocean while unpacking the boats. It got rained on often. It lived in the hip belt of my backpacking pack where it would get water and sweat on it sometimes. I even had it in my pants pocket while fording a river up to my hips. It's a champ.I was not expecting the picture quality to match my Canon SLR, so I can't say I was too surprised when I saw that macro shots of many awesome Costa Rican critters were blurry. That said, next expedition, I'm taking this camera and my SLR. Different cameras, different purposes.

Reviews.Title: Olympus Stylus 550WP
Reviews.Author: K. Shisler "Twin Mom"
Reviews.Content: Very good camera for the price.  This is the second one we have and have not had any problems from them.  Excellent picture quality, easy to use and waterproof.  Great for our kids.  Would highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: Not Waterproof
Reviews.Author: Cruiser "Cruiser"
Reviews.Content: We bought this camera to use when we snorkel; unfortunately the very first time I took it in the water it stopped working.  Back on shore I opened it up and water had leaked inside of the camera and destroyed it.  I read a lot of reviews on this camera and I did not read any that indicated this was a wide spread problem.  Everyone should know that the manufacture would not do anything since this water proof camera was water damaged. Fortunately, I had purchased an extended warranty and I was able to get back most of the money that I spent through the insurance.  I am not sure what we are going to buy but I am thinking the canon that is safe up to 30 feet would be a better choice even if it is more expensive.

Reviews.Title: Excellent quality for the price!
Reviews.Author: J. Stoudt
Reviews.Content: I was really excited as well as nervous to purchase this camera. I recently moved to Australia and one of the first trips I was going on when I first got here was to see the Great Barrier Reef. I was really excited to be able to take pictures of the reef but I was nervous something would go wrong with the camera and I wouldn't get my pictures. The camera worked amazing, and the pictures are remarkable. The camera is also extremely beneficial if you're going to be in an area where it rains a lot because you don't have to worry about hiding it, but you are still able to take pictures! I would highly recommend this camera!

Reviews.Title: stopped working by 3rd day
Reviews.Author: Arlene "Arlene"
Reviews.Content: My daughter received this for Christmas from Santa.  Great size for her, cool color and very easy to use. She loved it right away and began taking videos of her siblings playing with their toys right away.  Never got to try it out underwater since the lense cover jammed shut by the 3rd day of use. The picture quality was ok for the needs of a 9 year old, however, images seemed kind of grainy.Also, FYI, this camera takes a micor sd card wich apparnetly is only made for Olympus cameras.  What that meant for us is that our memory cards were not intenrchengeable.  Sometimes that comes in handy when a memory card is full and we don't have easy access to the computer for downloading.Amazon was great with the return which is part of the reason why I purchase through them.

Reviews.Title: And they call this camera WATERPROOF?
Reviews.Author: Monique "kodakqueen"
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera in Sept 2009 in St. Maartin while on a cruise.  I have used it for the past 8 months.  The quality pictures are ok and sometime pretty good.  More so if taken outside.  Inside shots tend to be dark in the background.  Battery does not hold a charge very long compared to my past digital cameras.  I had a panasonic last time that i used rechargable double A batteries...  that really held a charge LONG.  The rechargeable held up much longer than the disposable.  But this time i wanted more of a compact camera, which this is... and very easty to carry around.I take alot of pictures for our running club and was dissappointed that it did not have a BURST mode to takeserveral shots in a row of runners, but was happy that i could use it in the rain.Most of my past cameras went out on me after taking them to beaches, with the humidity and sand.  We have just returned yesterday from another cruise and i put this camera to the test.  Took it on a speedboat ride which did 360 degree turns and we were drenched in water..  camera worked fine.  Took it on the beach in the heat, humidity and sand... and it did fine.  Then the real test.  After 8 months i decided to try it underwater.  Says it can go 10 feet.  Well i went about 2 feet, 3 times and now the camera is completely dead.  Tried charging battery with no luck.

Reviews.Title: Shutter sticks - but otherwise a nice camera.
Reviews.Author: Michael Croteau
Reviews.Content: Shutter sticks - but otherwise a nice camera.Will get a workout once the ice clears and I take it fishing on the streams and lakes.

Reviews.Title: Excelente para el agua
Reviews.Author: Jorge Ramos
Reviews.Content: Es una camara Excelente, cumple con todas las caracteristicas para la diversion! en el agua. unico punto negativo la bateria no dura mucho.

Reviews.Title: Excellent camera
Reviews.Author: Rachel A. Adams
Reviews.Content: I got this underwater camera for my boyfriend for christmas, he loves it. cant wait for the summer for it to have the real test

Reviews.Title: Did not work the third time
Reviews.Author: TiffH "th"
Reviews.Content: I got so excited about this camera and took my family to the pool two consecutive days in a week. It worked fine under water at the pool even thought the photos quality was minimal (everything was so bright). We took it to the water park to use it for the third time. I thought that was so brilliant to have this camera and not worry about water getting in to it....the camera would not work while we were at the water park. it would turn on but cant take pciture and we couldnt even turn it off. we had to get out of the water park, dry ourself and then take out the battery to turn it off and turn it on and it did the same thing. so...we had the camera working for 2 weeks. it cost me around $140 on Amazon....it is definately cheapter and better to get a disposable camera....the worst part about it not working was....i was so sad about loosing my wonderful underwater camera...

Reviews.Title: Utterly failed at being waterproof
Reviews.Author: Nathan Humble
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera to take pictures while snorkeling in the Caribbean.  When I got the camera, I made sure to run it through some tests to make sure it would work under those conditions.  I tried it in a pool and then in the Pacific ocean, both worked fine.  So I went on my vacation armed with this camera and within 15 minutes of beginning snorkeling, the camera stopped responding to any of the buttons.  When I got the camera dried off, I opened it to find out that it had leaked and thusly corroded internally.  The camera is now completely unusable and even the memory card is unusable.  Amazon was very good about refunding the obviously flawed product, but I can't say that I recommend this at all.  If you want to take underwater pictures I think your better off with a disposable camera or a special underwater housing.

Reviews.Title: And i am not a picky person
Reviews.Author: Matercard "me"
Reviews.Content: This camera is awfull. It ruined all my vacation in Bahamas. The water shots is good thought but the whole camera is very complicated to use. It takes too long to display images, the image quality is not good, a lot shaking, pale image and the flash light is your worse enemy. I went to a disney cruise to celebrate my sons 10 aniversary, but i spent most of the time trying to figure how the camera works. I missed a lot good shots and memories that unfortunatelly will never came back. This camera is not recomended by me, i wish i could return it.i wish someone have told me before i buy it.

Reviews.Title: Terrible pictures, almost every time
Reviews.Author: R. Johnson
Reviews.Content: This camera is a complete POS.  Its too slow. Every picture I take out of doors is over-exposed. Its terrible for action shots. You can not move at all when you take the picture or else everything is a blur. Same goes for your subjects, if they move in the slightest they come out blurry.  So unless your subjects are frozen and you have a tri-pod, your photos will suck.

ProductInfo.Features:
10-megapixel resolution for photo-quality, poster-size prints
Lightweight, aluminum exterior; waterproof up to 10 feet
3x optical zoom; Face Detection
Perfect Fix in-camera editing
Compatible with xD Picture Cards and microSD memory cards (not included)
ProductInfo.Name: Olympus Stylus 550WP 10MP Waterproof Digital Camera with 3x Optical Zoom and 2.5-inch LCD (Black)
